Taking refuge in the honored ones of the three times, what is spoken by the Perfectly Enlightened One,
Always practicing benefiting others, accumulating various merits.
If one's own body, speech, and mind create good or evil karma,
The retribution of the results is definitely not mistaken, there is no other creator.
The supreme guide, having realized it, extends his compassion,
Universally for all sentient beings, he speaks of the retribution of karma.
This corresponding correct principle, having heard it, one should accept it,
The creation of karma is all one's own mind, which causes one to run through the six destinies.
Due to the fear of the three poisons, one trades the lives of various beings,

There, one's lifespan is a hundred thousand years, and one is struck with swords, clubs, and beatings,

If one harms one's parents, friends, and relatives,
and utters false words to deceive, one will fall into the Black Thread Hell;
Black threads will be drawn on one's body, like in the world when drawing wood,
the saw will emit blazing flames, receiving such painful retributions.
If one burns mountains, rivers, forests, trees, and fields with fire,
and harms sentient beings, one will fall into the Burning Hot Hell;
The flames will burn everywhere, with cries of pain unceasing,
both eyes will be blinded, receiving such painful retributions.
If one calls what is Dharma non-Dharma, slanders without basis,
and causes others to give rise to distress, one will fall into the Extremely Burning Hot Hell;
These sinful beings will be greatly oppressed by fire,
burning without a moment's respite, receiving such painful retributions.

Such sinful beings will fall into the Raurava Hell;
In that fiercely blazing fire, they are burned without rest,
Constantly emitting great evil sounds, receiving such painful retribution.

And those with virtue and wisdom,
Giving rise to extreme killing and harm, one will definitely fall into the AvÄ«ci Hell;
A great mass of blazing fire, burning through to the bone marrow,
For a long time one will experience extreme suffering, with no temporary happiness whatsoever.
Giving rise to enmity, hostility, and fighting, with spears and halberds injuring each other,
One will die and fall into the Copper Claws Hell, whose shape is extremely sharp and pointed;
Mutually tearing each other apart, or transforming into knives and staves,
Competing to chop and stab one's body, one will receive such painful retribution.
Forcefully invading others' colors, one will later fall into the Iron Thorn Hell,
With thorns sixteen fingers long, scraping the flesh and piercing the bones;
Moreover, there is a great iron woman, with flaming fangs extremely terrifying,
Eating from the crown of the head to the heels, one will receive such painful retribution.
If one secretly schemes to harm others, one will fall into the Sword Leaf Forest,
With rabid dogs and vultures rushing to compete in dividing up the food.
If one steals the wealth of others, one will experience extreme suffering,
Constantly swallowing hot iron balls, and being poured with molten copper.
If one unjustly harms living beings, one will fall into the iron eagle hell,
With sharp claws, pecking and striking, suffering for a long time.
If a person delights in injuring and killing aquatic creatures,
Later, one will fall into a river of molten copper, being burned by the fire of karma.
If one is greedy for one's own prosperity and conceals the goodness of others,
One will fall into the iron mill hell, wailing with no one to rescue or deliver.
If a person does not benefit others, one will receive many kinds of forms,
With two mountains pressing on one's body, squeezing and stabbing again.
If a person speaks of what is not the Dharma and destroys bridges,
Sharp blades will be made into a road, driving one to come and go.
If one uses one's nails to injure lice and fleas, one will fall into the two ram-headed mountains,
Striking each other, dying and reviving, they undergo suffering in turn.
Relying on the path of liberation, yet not guarding the precepts,
They fall into the burning embers hell, where their limbs all dissolve and rot.
Feigning various dignified behaviors, seeking wrong livelihood,
They fall into the corpse and excrement hell, to be gnawed by maggots.
Seeing insects in the five grains, indiscriminately threshing and plowing,
They fall into the iron mortar hell, always being pounded there.
Seeing the suffering of others and taking joy in it, deceitful and full of doubts,
Constantly harboring an angry and evil mind, they become Yama's henchmen.
The seeds of the fruits of suffering are briefly distinguished.
The pure body, speech, and mind are ultimately always avoided.
The hells are finished.
If a person does not enjoy giving and also steals the food and drink of the assembly,
They fall into the class of ghosts with large goiters, always eating filth.
If one obstructs others' giving, being stingy with one's own possessions,
They fall into the class of ghosts with needle mouths, with large bellies always hungry and thirsty.
Being childless and stingy with wealth, not giving or enjoying oneself,
They fall into the class of ghosts lacking in abundance, obtaining others' discarded leftovers.
Hoping for others' generosity, having little giving oneself and feeling regret,
They fall into the class of inferior ghosts, always eating saliva and vomit.
Liking to hear about others' faults, adding evil words to spread them,
They fall into the class of ghosts with flaming mouths, long suffering various afflictions.
Delighting in starting disputes, having no compassion at all,
They fall into the class of exhausted ghosts, eating wriggling insects.
Taking others' wealth through intimidation, obtaining it and giving a little,
They fall into the class of extremely ugly ghosts, others fearing them and obtaining meager offerings.
If a person delights in feasting and widely kills many lives,
Eating themselves and giving to others, they later fall into the RÄká¹£asa ghost.
If they sniff or secretly take the incense and flowers offered,
Due to a slight greedy mind, they later become a ghost that seeks out incense.
If a person has a request of someone they revere,
With an angry face hoping for their wealth, they later become a fierce and evil ghost.
If a person always enjoys acting as a matchmaker for others' marriages,
Later harboring ill will and separation, they die and become a PÅ«tana ghost.
If a person enjoys drinking alcohol, exceeding the proper amount and being intoxicated,
Or holding it and encouraging others to drink, they later become a YÄksa ghost.
If they wish to go against their parents, teachers, and elders,
Later born in the YÄksa palace, courageous and strong but often violent and impetuous.
Due to the faults of their stinginess and greed, they are always born among hungry ghosts,
Suffering and happiness follow one's own causes, therefore, do not create them again.
The realm of hungry ghosts is concluded.
Among the three evil destinies of humans, gods, and hungry ghosts, only one can save oneself,
Roaming in the six destinies, like a dream coming together.
Seeing one's own and others' relatives, lamenting, how can it last long?
Like that actor, repeatedly changing forms and colors.
Having experienced the suffering of hell, one may be reborn in the heavens,
When merit is exhausted, one sinks again, falling into the animal realm.
Experiencing various forms and colors, later one may be reborn as a human,
Poor and suffering greatly, like a wheel spinning.
The realm of animals is concluded.
The lifespan of those in the human realm, originally long,
Due to frequently creating the cause of killing, it is thereby shortened.
Entangled by various illnesses and suffering, leprosy, emaciation, epidemics, and so forth,
Being possessed by ghosts and spirits, and being beaten by the king's law.
If a person, for the sake of wealth, labors and seeks widely,
Without any thought of giving, they will later become a wealth-guarding ghost.
If a person steals others' wealth, uses it, and is able to give,
They will later fall into the ghost realm, and whatever they obtain will be scattered and lost.
If a person, from their own wealth, gives according to their means,
They will obtain wealth and abundance, and it will not be taken away by others.
If a person, with pure wealth, gives widely, free from stinginess,
They will obtain the best food and drink, and their desires will all be as they wish.
If a person, with delicious food, offers it with a pure mind,
The blessings and rewards they obtain will be beautiful, strong, long-lived, and secure.
If a person gives clothing, they will obtain love and joy,
And will obtain a beautiful appearance, and the clothing of shame and modesty.
If a person builds a monastery and joyfully offers it,
They will experience the adornments of palaces and the fulfillment of the five desires.
If a person constructs bridges and offers vehicles, etc.,
They will attain the highest peace and comfort, and precious palanquins.
If a person offers ponds, wells, and springs in the wilderness,
In all their places of birth, they will be free from thirst, exhaustion, and distress.
If a person offers concubines and adornments,
The fruits they attain will be endowed with sensual pleasures and wealth.
If a person offers scriptures and worldly texts,
And is able to uphold and give them to others, they will attain vast learning and great wisdom.
If a person offers medicine and fearlessness,
The fruits they attain will be blissful and free from terror.
If one offers lamps and light, their eyes will always be clear and pure;
If one gives musical instruments, one obtains a beautiful voice;
If one gives bedding, one obtains peaceful and blissful happiness;
If one gives servants, one is always surrounded by attendants;
Giving milk cows and other things, one obtains complexion, strength, and longevity;
If one gives good fields, one obtains overflowing granaries.
As each seeker desires,
Flowers, fruits, and clear springs, loving words, and good comfort;
Moreover, although one practices giving, one makes others work and gives little,
Because of fear, one gives rise to the aspiration, and one hopes for others' praise;
Or one seeks present wealth and nobility, to be born in the heavens and experience happiness,
Such practices of giving, the merit obtained is extremely small.
If one delights in practicing benefiting others, not sparing one's body and life,
Always harboring a compassionate mind, the holy fruits are not difficult to attain.
Those who come to beg, give according to the time,
Causing them to give rise to joy, and the fruits of retribution are obtained as wished.
If giving to them is difficult, the fruits of retribution received are also like that.
Taking away from oneself to give to others is the supreme blissful Dharma.
Giving is the basis of all happiness, like planting and growing fruit.
Having pity on those who come seeking, give according to their wishes without turning them away empty-handed.
Be careful not to invade others' spouses, regard them as your own children,
And even if you have your own wife, raise your mind and immediately stop.
If a person fixes his mind on sensual objects and delights in attachment,
In his next life, he will definitely receive the retribution of a female body in the world.
If a person is disgusted with a female body, abandons desire and upholds pure precepts,
Giving rise to a firm mind, he will transform his body and become a man.
If a person cultivates pure conduct, there will be no harm or trouble,
Endowed with merit, virtue, and spiritual power, they are always respected by gods and humans.
If one does not drink alcohol, one abides in right mindfulness,
Always speaking true words, one presently attains peace and security.
If one sees others in conflict, one persuades and reconciles them,
One will experience a vast and numerous retinue, without the suffering of separation.
Regarding the instructions of teachers and elders, one always joyfully listens and accepts them,
Weighing the pros and cons, one then possesses skillful wisdom.
To the poor and destitute who are employed, one is fond of beating and striking,
Harming others without fault, one adds suffering to one's own suffering.
If a person is endowed with physical appearance, relying on it to give rise to arrogance,
And mocking others, one will obtain the retribution of being short and hunchbacked.
If a person is stingy and contemptible, skillfully guided but pretending not to hear,
They are extremely foolish and dull-witted, and will obtain the retribution of being deaf and mute.
Practicing goodness brings blessings, accumulating evil invites suffering,
Each accomplishing their own cause, according to karma one will definitely experience.
The results of the human realm are concluded.
Always engaging in flattery and deception, delighting in anger and quarrels,
Due to practicing giving in the past, they become the lord of the asuras.
The asura realm is concluded.
Delighting in cultivating the ten wholesome causes, not harming others,
The gods always protect them, and they are born in the Heaven of the Four Kings.
To parents, the Three Jewels, respectfully giving according to one's ability,
Endowed with patience and gentleness, one is born in the Heaven of the Thirty-three.
Not delighting in disputes, encouraging others to be harmonious and compliant,
Purely cultivating wholesome causes, one is born in the Heaven of YÄma.
Delighting in hearing the true Dharma, single-mindedly cultivating liberating wisdom,

Always delighting in their intrinsic nature,
Giving rise to diligent courage, one can be reborn in the Heaven of Transformations.

Increasing the causes of liberation, one can be reborn in the Heaven of Others' Transformations.
Through the cultivation of precepts and concentration, universally benefiting through the power of vows,
Being reborn in the heavens and among humans, one reaches the true suchness of reality.
Thus the good and evil retributions have already been clearly revealed.
Doing good leads to rebirth as a human or god, creating evil brings about extreme suffering.
Before old age, sickness, and death arrive, diligently contemplate and seek the true Dharma.
Once one's own retribution comes, all that is loved will be separated.
Those faults such as greed and so forth, one should deeply give rise to disgust and aversion.
The wise one contemplates well, therefore one should distance oneself from them.
If one always practices benefiting others, then there will be no obstructions or afflictions,
